content.raw:
We keep backwards compatibility with "merge_analysis", but break backwards compatibility with "merge_distributed_set".  Do we want to add a


```
#!python

merge_distributed_set = merge_process_files_single_set
```


down in the backwards compatibility layer?

This just broke in one of my commonly used post-analysis scripts; worrisomely, it did so with a silent failure (likely due to me using at try/except structure around it for other reasons).  It may affect other users down the road.
content.html:
We keep backwards compatibility with "merge_analysis", but break backwards compatibility with "merge_distributed_set". Do we want to add a

merge_distributed_set = merge_process_files_single_set

down in the backwards compatibility layer?

This just broke in one of my commonly used post-analysis scripts; worrisomely, it did so with a silent failure (likely due to me using at try/except structure around it for other reasons). It may affect other users down the road.
